GapFillDragDrop.Title: Verb patterns 2
GapFillDragDrop.Instruction: Click on the words and drag them to the correct gap.

Content.Question:
1. She stopped to pick up some milk and flour from the local supermarket.
2. We regretted informing Bryan of our plans because he gossiped and soon everyone knew.
3. Following a month of freezing winds it went on to snow for a whole week.
4. Will you remember to wake me up tomorrow before you leave or should I set the alarm?
5. You weren't meant to see that; it was supposed to be a secret.
6. Please try to count more accurately next time; you got the numbers completely wrong.
7. I stopped picking up the toys which the baby had thrown onto the floor, and just left them there.
8. I remember waking up in a garden with blood on my face but I don't know how I got there.
9. I regret to inform you that your application for a visa has been rejected.
10. So you can't sleep? Try counting sheep. It worked for me.
11. Going home meant seeing my uncle, and he was the last person on Earth I wanted to be with.
12. Throughout March and April it went on snowing even though the forecasts said it would stop.
